articles.title: Introducing Incremental Refresh Policies for Dataflows in Power BI
articles.content:
Today, we're excited to announce the general availability of incremental refresh policies for dataflows in Power BI. This highly requested feature enables more efficient data refresh processes, reduced load on data sources, and faster refresh times for your large datasets.

Incremental refresh allows you to refresh only the data that has changed since the last refresh operation, rather than refreshing the entire dataset. This is particularly valuable for large datasets where refreshing all data would be time-consuming and resource-intensive.

With this release, Power BI dataflows now support the same incremental refresh capabilities that have been available in Power BI datasets. You can define refresh policies based on date/time parameters, allowing you to specify which data should be refreshed and which should be retained from previous refreshes.

## How to Configure Incremental Refresh

Setting up incremental refresh for your dataflows is straightforward:

1. Open Power BI service and navigate to the workspace containing your dataflow
2. Edit the dataflow and select the entity you want to configure
3. Click on the "Incremental Refresh" button in the toolbar
4. Define your refresh parameters including:
   - RangeStart and RangeEnd parameters
   - Refresh window (how far back to refresh data)
   - Archive window (how much historical data to retain)

Once configured, Power BI will automatically apply your incremental refresh policy during scheduled refreshes.

## Benefits for Enterprise Scenarios

For enterprise users working with large datasets, incremental refresh offers several key benefits:

- **Reduced refresh times**: Only refresh data that has changed
- **More reliable refreshes**: Shorter refresh operations are less likely to timeout
- **Lower source system load**: Minimize impact on source databases
- **Efficient resource utilization**: Better use of Power BI capacity resources

## Limitations and Considerations

When implementing incremental refresh policies, keep in mind these important considerations:

- Incremental refresh is available for dataflows in Premium and Embedded capacities
- The dataflow must include date/time columns to define refresh ranges
- Initial refresh operations will still process all data
- Certain dataflow transformations might affect how incremental refresh policies work

## What's Next

We're continuing to improve dataflow capabilities in Power BI. In the coming months, you can expect additional features that will enhance your data preparation and management workflows, including enhanced compute engine support and new transformation capabilities.

We encourage you to try the new incremental refresh policies for dataflows and share your feedback through the Power BI Ideas forum or community discussions. Your input directly influences our product roadmap and helps us deliver the features you need.

To learn more about incremental refresh in Power BI, review our detailed documentation which includes step-by-step guidance and best practices for implementation in enterprise environments.
articles.ai_summary: Microsoft announces general availability of incremental refresh policies for dataflows in Power BI, enabling more efficient data refresh processes. This feature allows users to refresh only changed data since the last refresh operation, reducing load on data sources and improving performance. The capability supports customizable refresh windows with date/time parameters and is particularly valuable for large datasets in enterprise environments.
articles.target_audience: Data Engineers, BI Developers, Data Analysts, Power BI Users

articles.title: Azure Data Factory: Announcing Enhanced Git Integration and CI/CD Capabilities
articles.content:
We're thrilled to announce significant enhancements to Azure Data Factory's Git integration and CI/CD capabilities, designed to streamline your data integration development lifecycle and foster better team collaboration.

As organizations increasingly adopt DevOps practices for their data integration projects, the need for robust source control, automated testing, and deployment pipelines has become essential. These new capabilities directly address these needs, making it easier to implement professional software development practices for your data pipelines.

## Enhanced Git Integration

The updated Git integration in Azure Data Factory now offers:

### Branch Protection and Policies
You can now enforce branch policies directly from Azure Data Factory, ensuring code quality and proper review processes. This includes:
- Requiring pull request reviews before merging
- Limiting direct commits to protected branches
- Setting up automatic build validation

### Improved Conflict Resolution
Managing merge conflicts has been significantly improved with:
- Visual difference highlighting for conflicting resources
- Interactive conflict resolution interface
- Ability to keep source or target changes with a single click
- Support for resolving conflicts on complex nested objects

### Enhanced Pull Request Experience
The pull request experience now includes:
- Detailed visual diff for all ADF artifacts
- Comments and discussions tied directly to specific changes
- Ability to approve or request changes directly from ADF portal

## Advanced CI/CD Capabilities

We've completely revamped the CI/CD capabilities in Azure Data Factory:

### ARM Template Enhancements
The generated ARM templates now feature:
- Selective deployment of specific resources
- Parameter inheritance across environments
- Dynamic parameter resolution during deployment
- Improved handling of sensitive information

### New Azure DevOps Integration
The Azure DevOps integration now includes:
- Pre-built pipeline templates for common scenarios
- Customizable validation tests for data pipelines
- Deployment approvals and gates
- Environment-specific configuration management

### GitHub Actions Support
We've added comprehensive support for GitHub Actions with:
- Official ADF GitHub Actions for deployment
- Workflow templates for various CI/CD scenarios
- Integrated security scanning for pipelines
- Automated testing frameworks

## Automated Testing Framework

One of the most requested features, we're introducing a built-in testing framework for Azure Data Factory that allows you to:

- Create and run unit tests for individual activities and transforms
- Set up integration tests that validate end-to-end pipelines
- Define data quality validation rules that must pass before deployment
- Compare actual outputs against expected results
- Generate test coverage reports for your pipelines

## Getting Started

To start using these new capabilities:

1. Ensure your Data Factory is configured with Git integration
2. Update to the latest Azure Data Factory UI
3. Visit the new "DevOps" tab in your Data Factory portal
4. Follow the guided setup to configure your preferred CI/CD approach

For detailed documentation on each feature, including step-by-step implementation guides and best practices, visit our official documentation.

## Looking Ahead

These enhancements represent a major step forward in bringing professional software development practices to data integration projects. In the coming months, we'll continue to expand these capabilities with:

- Test data generation for pipeline validation
- Schema drift detection in CI/CD pipelines
- Performance testing and benchmarking
- Enhanced monitoring and alerting integration

We welcome your feedback on these new features through UserVoice or the Azure Data Factory GitHub repository. Your input directly shapes our roadmap as we continue to evolve Azure Data Factory into the most comprehensive and developer-friendly data integration platform available.
articles.ai_summary: Microsoft announces significant enhancements to Azure Data Factory's Git integration and CI/CD capabilities to streamline the data integration development lifecycle. The updates include improved branch protection, conflict resolution, and pull request experiences for better team collaboration. New CI/CD features include ARM template enhancements, Azure DevOps integration, GitHub Actions support, and a built-in testing framework for more robust pipeline development.
articles.target_audience: Data Engineers, DevOps Engineers, Cloud Architects, ETL Developers

articles.title: Microsoft Fabric: Unified Analytics Platform Now Generally Available
articles.content:
Today marks a significant milestone as we announce the general availability of Microsoft Fabric, our unified analytics platform that brings together data engineering, data integration, data warehousing, data science, real-time analytics, and business intelligence into a single, integrated environment.

Since we first unveiled Microsoft Fabric in preview at Build 2023, thousands of organizations have been testing and implementing solutions on the platform. The feedback has been overwhelmingly positive, with users highlighting the seamless integration, improved productivity, and reduced complexity compared to traditional fragmented analytics stacks.

## A Truly Unified Analytics Platform

Microsoft Fabric represents a fundamental shift in how organizations approach their data and analytics infrastructure. Instead of managing separate tools and platforms for different analytics needs, Fabric provides a single environment where all data professionals can collaborate using the tools and languages they prefer.

Key components of Microsoft Fabric include:

### Data Engineering
Fabric's data engineering experience offers a comprehensive set of tools for data engineers to ingest, transform, and prepare data at scale. This includes Apache Spark compute, notebooks, data pipelines, and ETL/ELT capabilities—all integrated into a seamless experience.

### Data Integration
Built on the proven technology of Azure Data Factory, Fabric's data integration capabilities allow you to connect to virtually any data source, orchestrate data movement, and transform data with over 150 native connectors.

### Data Warehousing
The Fabric data warehouse combines the best of traditional data warehousing with modern, cloud-scale architecture. It provides T-SQL querying, automatic query optimization, and integrated data loading capabilities with limitless scale.

### Data Science
For data scientists, Fabric offers integrated machine learning capabilities that streamline the ML lifecycle. Build, train, deploy, and manage models using familiar tools like notebooks, automated ML, and integrated MLOps.

### Real-time Analytics
Real-time analytics in Fabric enables you to process and analyze streaming data with low latency. This includes capabilities for stream processing, complex event processing, and real-time dashboarding.

### Business Intelligence
Power BI is fully integrated into the Fabric experience, providing industry-leading business intelligence capabilities directly connected to your data assets in Fabric.

## OneLake: The Foundation for Unified Analytics

At the core of Microsoft Fabric is OneLake, a single data lake for your entire organization. OneLake solves the common challenges of data silos and duplication by providing:

- A single copy of data accessible to all Fabric experiences
- Automatic format conversion between different analytics engines
- Built-in data governance and security
- Support for open formats including Delta, Parquet, and CSV
- Direct Query capabilities from Power BI and other tools

OneLake implements the Delta Lake open-source format as its native storage format, ensuring compatibility with a wide range of tools and services in the broader analytics ecosystem.

## Cross-platform Integration

While Microsoft Fabric provides a unified experience, we recognize that many organizations have existing investments in various data platforms and tools. Fabric is designed to work seamlessly with:

- Azure services like Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Explorer, and Azure Machine Learning
- Third-party analytics tools through standard interfaces (ODBC, JDBC, REST)
- Open-source frameworks including Spark, Delta, and popular ML libraries
- Existing BI tools via industry-standard query interfaces

## Getting Started with Microsoft Fabric

Microsoft Fabric is available in two editions:

- **Microsoft Fabric Capacity**: A dedicated tenant resource with predictable performance and cost
- **Pay-as-you-go (Preview)**: Consumption-based pricing for organizations with variable workloads

Existing Power BI Premium customers automatically have access to Microsoft Fabric with their current licenses.

To get started:

1. Visit the Microsoft Fabric website
2. Sign up for a free trial to explore the platform
3. Review the comprehensive documentation and learning resources
4. Join the Fabric community to connect with other users and experts

## Looking Forward

This general availability release is just the beginning of the Microsoft Fabric journey. Our roadmap includes:

- Expanded industry-specific templates and solutions
- Enhanced data governance and lineage capabilities
- Deeper integration with Azure services and the broader Microsoft cloud
- Advanced AI/ML features leveraging the latest innovations
- Additional performance optimizations for large-scale analytics

We invite you to start your Microsoft Fabric journey today and join us in redefining how organizations leverage data and analytics to drive business value. Your feedback is crucial as we continue to evolve the platform, so please share your experiences and suggestions through our feedback channels.

For more information, detailed documentation, and guidance on migrating existing workloads to Microsoft Fabric, visit the official Microsoft Fabric website and resource center.
articles.ai_summary: Microsoft announces the general availability of Microsoft Fabric, a unified analytics platform that integrates data engineering, integration, warehousing, science, real-time analytics, and business intelligence. At its core is OneLake, a single data lake for organizations that solves data silo challenges and supports open formats like Delta Lake. The platform offers seamless integration with existing Microsoft tools and third-party analytics solutions while providing multiple pricing options.
articles.target_audience: Data Engineers, Data Scientists, BI Professionals, IT Decision Makers, Analytics Teams

articles.title: Azure Machine Learning: New AutoML Capabilities for Computer Vision and NLP
articles.content:
We're excited to announce significant enhancements to Azure Machine Learning's Automated ML (AutoML) capabilities, extending our industry-leading automated machine learning technology to computer vision and natural language processing (NLP) tasks. These new capabilities make it easier than ever for data scientists and developers with varying levels of ML expertise to build high-quality vision and language models without extensive manual experimentation.

## Automated ML for Computer Vision

AutoML for Computer Vision now supports the following task types:

### Image Classification
Build multi-class and multi-label image classification models without writing complex deep learning code. AutoML will automatically:

- Select and tune appropriate neural network architectures
- Apply optimal data augmentation strategies
- Implement transfer learning from state-of-the-art pre-trained models
- Handle class imbalance with appropriate techniques
- Provide model interpretability through activation maps and feature importance

### Object Detection
Create models that can identify and locate multiple objects within images:

- Automatic architecture search among leading object detection frameworks
- Optimization for both accuracy and inference speed
- Support for custom object classes and domain-specific detection tasks
- Built-in evaluation with industry-standard metrics (mAP, IoU)
- Export to ONNX format for deployment across various platforms

### Instance Segmentation
Build advanced models that can detect objects and identify their precise boundaries:

- Pixel-level accuracy for detailed object delineation
- Automatic hyperparameter tuning for segmentation networks
- Support for complex multi-class segmentation scenarios
- Integration with Azure ML's MLOps capabilities for model management

## Automated ML for NLP

For natural language processing, we've expanded AutoML to support:

### Text Classification
Develop models for sentiment analysis, content moderation, topic classification, and more:

- Automatic selection between traditional ML and transformer-based approaches
- Built-in handling of text preprocessing and feature extraction
- Support for multi-label and hierarchical classification
- Optimization for both accuracy and inference latency

### Named Entity Recognition (NER)
Extract structured information from unstructured text documents:

- Identify and classify entities such as people, organizations, locations, dates, etc.
- Custom entity support for domain-specific applications
- Automatic handling of entity span alignment and tokenization
- Integration with Azure Cognitive Services for pre-built entity types

### Question Answering
Build models that can provide specific answers to natural language questions:

- Automated fine-tuning of transformer models for QA tasks
- Support for both extractive and abstractive QA approaches
- Built-in evaluation using BLEU, ROUGE, and exact match metrics
- Optimizations for production deployment scenarios

## Key Benefits

These new AutoML capabilities deliver several important benefits:

### Democratized Advanced ML
Data scientists without deep expertise in computer vision or NLP can now build high-quality models for these complex domains. AutoML handles the intricate details of architecture selection, hyperparameter tuning, and optimization techniques that typically require specialized knowledge.

### Accelerated Development
What would normally take weeks of experimentation can now be accomplished in hours or days. AutoML automates the most time-consuming aspects of model development, allowing data scientists to focus on problem definition and business integration.

### Production-Ready Models
Models created through AutoML are optimized not just for accuracy, but also for production deployment. This includes considerations for inference speed, memory usage, and integration with Azure ML's robust MLOps capabilities.

### Responsible AI Built-in
All AutoML capabilities include built-in responsible AI tools, including:
- Fairness monitoring and mitigation
- Model interpretability and explainability
- Data profiling and quality analysis
- Error analysis and performance monitoring

## Getting Started

To start using these new AutoML capabilities:

1. Navigate to your Azure Machine Learning workspace
2. Select "Automated ML" from the left navigation
3. Create a new Automated ML run
4. Select the appropriate task type (image classification, object detection, text classification, etc.)
5. Configure your dataset, compute, and experiment settings
6. Launch your AutoML run

The Azure ML platform will then automatically try various approaches, architectures, and hyperparameters to identify the best model for your specific data and requirements.

## Comprehensive Documentation and Samples

To help you get the most from these new capabilities, we've published comprehensive documentation and sample notebooks demonstrating common scenarios for each task type. These resources include:

- End-to-end tutorials for each vision and NLP task
- Best practices for data preparation and model deployment
- Guidance on interpreting AutoML results and selecting the right model
- Sample code for integrating AutoML models into applications

Visit the Azure ML documentation hub to access these resources and start building your vision and NLP models today.

## Continued Innovation

These enhancements represent our ongoing commitment to making advanced machine learning more accessible to a broader range of practitioners. In the coming months, we'll continue to expand AutoML capabilities with:

- Additional computer vision tasks such as image segmentation and video analysis
- More NLP capabilities including summarization and language generation
- Enhanced support for multi-modal models combining text, images, and other data types
- Deeper integration with Azure OpenAI Service

We're excited to see what you'll build with these new capabilities. As always, we welcome your feedback through the Azure ML feedback forum or GitHub repository.
articles.ai_summary: Microsoft enhances Azure Machine Learning's Automated ML capabilities with new support for computer vision and natural language processing tasks. The update adds AutoML for image classification, object detection, instance segmentation, text classification, named entity recognition, and question answering. These improvements democratize advanced ML, accelerate development, and provide production-ready models with responsible AI built-in to help data scientists build high-quality models without extensive manual experimentation.
articles.target_audience: Data Scientists, ML Engineers, AI Developers, Computer Vision Specialists, NLP Practitioners

articles.title: Introducing Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse: Real-time Analytics for Business Applications
articles.content:
Today, we're excited to announce the general availability of Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse, a cloud-native integration that enables seamless, real-time analytics over data stored in Microsoft Dataverse. This integration brings together the power of business applications data in Dynamics 365 and the advanced analytics capabilities of Azure Synapse Analytics.

For organizations using Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, this announcement represents a significant advancement in their ability to derive insights from their business data without complex ETL processes or data movement configurations.

## Breaking Down Data Silos

Many organizations struggle with a disconnect between their operational data (stored in business applications) and their analytical systems. This disconnect often requires complex, costly ETL pipelines that introduce latency and create maintenance challenges.

Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse eliminates these challenges by automatically synchronizing data from Dataverse to Azure Synapse Analytics in near real-time. This synchronization happens without any impact on the performance of your operational systems, ensuring that business users can continue to work uninterrupted while analytics teams gain access to the latest data.

## Key Capabilities

Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse provides several powerful capabilities:

### Near Real-time Data Synchronization
- Change data capture technology detects and propagates changes within minutes
- Support for both initial data sync and ongoing incremental updates
- Optimized data transfer with minimal impact on source systems

### Schema Flexibility and Evolution
- Automatic schema mapping between Dataverse and Synapse
- Support for schema evolution as your Dataverse environment changes
- Preservation of relationships between entities

### Comprehensive Data Integration
- Support for all standard and custom entities in Dataverse
- Inclusion of complex data types and relationships
- Option to filter specific entities or fields for synchronization

### Simplified Security and Governance
- Integrated authentication and authorization
- Centralized data governance and lineage tracking
- Audit capabilities for regulatory compliance

### Advanced Analytics Enablement
- Direct access to data using T-SQL, Spark, or serverless SQL
- Integration with Azure Machine Learning for predictive analytics
- Power BI integration for intuitive data visualization

## Common Scenarios

Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse enables numerous analytics scenarios across different Dynamics 365 applications:

### Customer Insights
- Combine customer interaction data from Dynamics 365 Sales, Customer Service, and Marketing
- Enrich with external data sources in Synapse Analytics
- Build 360-degree customer views and predictive models for churn, lifetime value, and next best action

### Supply Chain Optimization
- Analyze inventory, procurement, and logistics data from Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
- Integrate with IoT data from manufacturing systems
- Develop demand forecasting and inventory optimization models

### Financial Analytics
- Consolidate financial data from Dynamics 365 Finance
- Implement advanced financial forecasting and scenario planning
- Develop detailed cost attribution and profitability analysis

### Field Service Optimization
- Analyze service calls, technician performance, and parts usage from Dynamics 365 Field Service
- Develop predictive maintenance models
- Optimize technician scheduling and routing

## Getting Started

Setting up Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse is straightforward:

1. Ensure you have the necessary Azure Synapse Analytics workspace and Dataverse environment
2. Navigate to the Power Platform admin center
3. Select your Dataverse environment and enable Synapse Link
4. Configure which tables to synchronize and the sync frequency
5. Access your Dataverse data in Azure Synapse Analytics

We've published detailed documentation, including step-by-step setup instructions, best practices, and sample queries to help you get started quickly.

## Technical Architecture

Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse uses a highly optimized architecture designed for performance, reliability, and scalability:

1. Changes in Dataverse are captured using a low-impact change tracking mechanism
2. Data is efficiently transferred to Azure Synapse via a secure, managed service
3. Data is stored in Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 in an optimized format
4. The data is immediately available for query through Synapse's serverless SQL pool and Spark pool

This architecture ensures that your analytical workloads can scale independently from your operational systems, providing optimal performance for both.

## Pricing and Availability

Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse is generally available worldwide in all Azure regions where Synapse Analytics is available. There is no additional charge for using Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse beyond the standard costs of Azure Synapse Analytics and Azure Data Lake Storage.

## Looking Ahead

This release marks the beginning of our journey to provide seamless integration between operational data in Dynamics 365 and analytical capabilities in Azure. Our roadmap includes:

- Enhanced metadata and schema handling for complex scenarios
- Additional performance optimizations for very large datasets
- Expanded integration with other Azure analytics services
- Advanced data transformation capabilities within the link

We invite you to start using Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse today and share your feedback with us through the Dynamics 365 Community Portal or Azure Synapse Analytics feedback channels. Your input will help shape the future of this integration and ensure it meets your evolving analytics needs.
articles.ai_summary: Microsoft announces general availability of Azure Synapse Link for Dataverse, enabling seamless real-time analytics over data stored in Microsoft Dataverse. This cloud-native integration eliminates complex ETL processes by automatically synchronizing data from Dataverse to Azure Synapse Analytics in near real-time. The solution supports schema flexibility, comprehensive data integration, and advanced analytics while maintaining security and governance, allowing business users to work uninterrupted while analytics teams access the latest data.
articles.target_audience: Data Engineers, Business Analysts, Dynamics 365 Users, Power Platform Developers, Solution Architects
